quizzes.question: What tag is used to create a link to a web page?
quizzes.textContent: [h1]The Tag[/h1] Links are also an integral part of every web page. You can add links to text or images that will enable the user to click on them in order to be directed to another file or webpage. In HTML, links are defined using the [b][/b] tag. Use the [b]href [/b]attribute to define the link's destination address: [code format="html"][/code]

quizzes.question: Which attribute of the link tag contains the URL location that you are trying to link to?
quizzes.textContent: [h1]Creating Your First Link[/h1] In the example below, a link to SoloLearn's website is defined: [code format="html" codeId="23"] Learn Playing [/code] Once the code has been saved, "Learn Playing" will display as a link: [u]Learn Playing[/u] Clicking on "[b]Learn Playing[/b]" redirects you to www.sololearn.com [note]Links can be either absolute or relative.[/note]

quizzes.question: Which value of the target attribute makes the link open in a new tab or a new window?
quizzes.textContent: [h1]The target Attribute[/h1] The [b]target [/b]attribute specifies where to open the linked document. Giving a [b]_blank[/b] value to your attribute will have the link open in a new window or new tab: [code format="html" codeId="24"] Learn Playing [/code]
